attributes.action: Revoke IR35 rules causing businesses to blanket ban engaging LTDs under contract
attributes.additional_details:
The country needs economic stability and a competitive edge. IR35 means reduced ability to ramp up and down as projects require and increased cost if contractors are engaged.

Many will be forced to take inside-IR35 contracts in order to pay bills even though they are legitimately outside which will mean decimating their ability to grow their businesses.

Agencies / recruiters are also affected putting thousands of jobs at risk as markets dry up.

Please reconsider this damaging approach to tax.
attributes.background: Recent IR35 changes mean that many larger organisations are no longer willing to engage limited company-based contractors. The government indicated that blanket in or out decisions on contractors would not be allowed but instead, larger organisations have decided to just stop engaging entirely.

rejection.details:
On 17 March 2020 the Government announced that it was postponing the reforms to the off-payroll working rules IR35 from April 2020 to 6 April 2021.

https://hansard.parliament.uk/Commons/2020-03-17/debates/9038AB35-B474-48EC-83EC-A1CA7347043A/IncomeTax(Charge)#contribution-4C019642-2598-4500-A5EE-2942C2DDCFB4

We have published a petition calling for the Government to revoke IR35 legislation, which you might be interested in: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300458
